quote: Until then, Commander Maddox, I will continue learning, changing, growing, and trying to become more than what I am.
author: Data

quote: If only rain could fall inside a room.
author: John M. Hull

quote: When you don't create things, you become defined by your tastes rather than ability. Your tastes only narrow & exclude people. so create.
author: Why the lucky stiff

quote: Beware of overconcern for money, or position, or glory. Someday you will meet a man who cares for none of these things. Then you will know how poor you are.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Anything you need to quantify can be measured in some way that is superior to not measuring it at all.
author: Tom Gilb

quote: There are a million ways to lose a work day, but not even a single way to get one back.
author: Tom DeMarco and Timothy Lister

quote: No one is against you. They are for themselves. Learn this and you will make friends of enemies.
author: Ed Calderon's mother

quote: You can't pickpocket a naked man; so just get naked.
author: Ed Calderon's unnamed friend

quote: Lots of the people were mean, and most of them were miserable, even the ones with digital watches.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Men are what they are because of what they do. Not what they say.
author: Fredrik Backman, A Man Called Ove

quote: If you're thinking without writing, you only think you’re thinking.
author: Leslie Lamport

quote: A time... comes for every man, when he chooses what sort of man he wants to be. And if you don't know the story, you don't know the man.
author: Fredrik Backman, A Man Called Ove

quote: I'd rather die drunk, broke at 34 and have people at a dinner table talk about me than live to be rich and sober at 90 and nobody remembered who I was.
author: Andrew, Whiplash

quote: yes is nothing without how.
author: Chris Voss

quote: So I saw that there is nothing better for a person than to enjoy their work, because that is their lot.
author: Solomon

quote: A fish only discovers its need for water when it is no longer in it.
author: Fons Trompenaars

quote: Man, too, became a machine, using reason to drive a somewhat reluctant body to obey rational dictates.
author: Fons Trompenaars

quote: Find what you love and let it kill you.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Objects are poor man's closures.
author: unknown

quote: Closures are poor man's objects.
author: unknown

quote: Whenever possible, steal code.
author: Tom Duff

quote: To learn and not to do is really not to learn. To know and not to do is really not to know.
author: Stephen R. Covey

quote: Tell me if anything was ever done ... Tell me ... Tell me ... Tell me if ever I did a thing ... Tell me if anything was ever made.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: More battles are lost by loss of hope than loss of blood.
author: Napoleon

quote: Everything on earth depends on will. I never had an idea in my life. I've got no imagination. I never dream.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: If I were not Alexander, I wish I were Diogenes.
author: Alexander the Great

quote: He that lives upon hope, dies farting.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: We can't solve problems by using the same kind of thinking we used when we created them.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If a man empties his purse into his head, no man can take it away from him. An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The more one knows, the more one can do. The more one can do, the more one ought to do.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He who liveth upon hope dies farting.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If you want to get smart the question you've got to keep asking is: Why? Why? Why? Why?
author: Charlie Munger

quote: Remember that reputation and integrity are your most valuable assets and can be lost in a heartbeat.
author: Charlie Munger

quote: People calculate too much and think too little.
author: Charlie Munger

quote: People are trying to be smart all I am trying to do is not to be idiotic, but it's harder than most people think.
author: Charlie Munger

quote: I don't mind shaking hands with a human being, are you one?
author: Malcolm X

quote: Do not talk to me of goodness, of abstract justice, of nature law. Necessity is the highest law, public welfare is the highest justice.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Only knowledge can turn life's unbearableness into a weapon.
author: Yukio Mishima, The Temple of the Golden Pavilion

quote: The special quality of hell is to see everything clearly down to the last detail.
author: Yukio Mishima, The Temple of the Golden Pavilion

quote: Man is not a rational animal, he is a rationalizing animal.
author: Richard Hamming

quote: What you do to become successful is likely to be counterproductive when applied at a later date.
author: Richard Hamming

quote: The true test of a man’s character is what he does when no one is watching.
author: John Wooden

quote: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are.
author: John Wooden

quote: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have the time to do it over?
author: John Wooden

quote: Seek opportunities to show you care. The smallest gestures often make the biggest difference.
author: John Wooden

quote: It is amazing how much can be accomplished if no one cares who gets the credit.
author: John Wooden

quote: Players with fight never lose a game, they just run out of time.
author: John Wooden

quote: Be quick, but don't hurry.
author: John Wooden

quote: If we magnified blessings as much as we magnify disappointments, we would all be much happier.
author: John Wooden

quote: Make every day your masterpiece.
author: John Wooden
